body.name: Steve Madden Women's Long Chevron Maxi Puffer Coat
features: Elevate your winter style to new heights with the fashionable and functional long winter puffer coat by Steve Madden; This outerwear masterpiece seamlessly marries stunning aesthetics with exceptional performance, ensuring you remain warm, dry, and utterly stylish during the cold winter months; Whether you're heading to work, attending social events, or going on a casual outing, this long maxi puffer coat effortlessly complements any winter look

Winter weather is no match for this coat's 100% polyester water and wind-resistant exterior; Filled with warm vegan polyester insulation with a cozy upper fleece lining; Intentionally designed to withstand the harshest winter conditions while keeping you toasty warm and stylish; With its commitment to warmth, durability, and vegan materials, it's the ultimate choice for those who demand a heavy, reliable, and sustainable winter coat that will stand up to the toughest winter challenges

Easy care-one of the many key features of this coat is that it's machine washable, making it a practical choice for busy individuals who seek easy maintenance without compromising on quality; Sleek design-the classic puffer design features horizontal quilted stitching, not only adding a fashionable texture but also guaranteeing consistent insulation; This coat is designed to trap warmth efficiently, keeping you comfortable in extreme cold

Featuring two large front zipper pockets, allowing you to keep your hands warm and your essentials close; The detachable hood adds versatility to the coat, allowing you to adapt to changing weather conditions; Storm cuffs with thumb holes; The high collar and was built to protect your face and neck from the harsh winter elements; Soft upper fleece lining; Dual closure system-front zipper and button closure; Built for multiple layers; If between sizes, size down

Introducing Steve Madden outerwear, where fashion meets functionality to provide you with the perfect blend of style and warmth; With a rich heritage in footwear, Steve Madden has expanded its expertise to create outerwear that complements your unique fashion sensibilities while keeping you cozy in the chilliest of seasons; Indulge in the ultimate winter fashion experience with this coat that's a fusion of fashion-forward design and winter functionality
body.description: Steve Madden Women's Long Maxi Winter Puffer Coat Elevate your winter style to new heights with the fashionable and functional long winter puffer coat by Steve Madden. This outerwear masterpiece seamlessly marries stunning aesthetics with exceptional performance, ensuring you remain warm, dry, and utterly stylish during the cold winter months. HIGH-QUALITY MATERIALS: Winter weather is no match for this coat's 100% polyester water and wind-resistant exterior; Filled with warm vegan polyester insulation with a cozy upper fleece lining MACHINE WASHABLE: one of the many key features of this coat is that it's machine washable, making it a practical choice for busy individuals who seek easy maintenance without compromising on quality SLEEK DESIGN: the classic puffer design features horizontal quilted stitching, not only adding a fashionable texture but also guaranteeing consistent insulation FEATURES: Two large front zipper pockets, storm cuffs, detachable hood, oversized collar, front zipper and button closure RUNS LARGE: This coat was built for layering so it tends to run large; If between size down

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The jacket fits perfectly and is very flattering, love the removable hood
reviews.reviewText: I am over 50. Stand 5'4" tall, weighing 143 lbs. I wear a woman's regular length pant, I do have a slightly long torso. The jacket fits perfectly. The waist band in the back hits me perfectly. I have always been concerned about a jacket in this length because of my shorter height, but it is much more flattering than I anticipated. I expected I would end up returning it but gave it a try anyway, I took a chance, and I am so glad that I did. Even at my shorter height the jacket length is perfect, especially when I am waring skirts or dresses for work. I especially like the fact that I can remove the hood and the collar is substantial enough to keep the warmth around my neck even without the hood. The weather has been in the -10 degrees and this jacket kept me warm! I am so glad I stepped out of my comfort zone and gave this coat a try! If you are a petite woman, do not let that scare you! The Coat is very flattering even for a shorter person like myself.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stylish well made coat
reviews.reviewText: Flattering, warm, fullty lined, full length winter coat.Zipper a bit tricky to use but has great snaps which work great. Oversized removable hood. Fabric inside cuffs to block air from outside getting in. Great price!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect size and color.
reviews.reviewText: I like the warmth this provided while shoveling snow. The neck provides extra warmth and the interior cuffs keep out the cold wind. The fabric and construction are fine. The style is great, especially with the hint of a waist in the back. It's so much better than the big refrigerator look. The buttons let you run outside for a few minutes without messing with the zipper. The pockets are placed well and padded for warmth. I think I'll get many years out of this coat.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Love the coat, hated the pockets....
reviews.reviewText: I ended up returning this coat for no other reason than I'm really tall & have a broader back with a really long arm span & needed a size xxl & the sizing only went up to xl. Loved the pillow collar & length of the coat, but the pockets were very awkwardly placed & very uncomfortable. The pockets were placed on the front of the coat, on top of the hip/upper thigh area vs. the sides where your arms/hands naturally hang. Aside from that it had great fixtures, look & warmth, just wish I could've found it in a sze larger.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very long but good coat
reviews.reviewText: I'm 5' tall and this coat is almost ankle length on me. What's great about it is that the zipper ends around my knee, and I was able to sew magnetic snaps around the hem and lining to add a really killer knee length configuration to it. I can let it out if I want the full-length insulation, or tack it up to look less ridiculous when conditions are better. In New England, you do what you've got to do.I have a lot of good things to say about this coat as-is, or I wouldn't have bothered modifying it. The material is heavier than a lot of puffers, and it doesn't feel delicate around the seams, buttons, or snaps. It has a soft sheen but isn't too shiny. The panel of smocking across the back of the waist adds a mildly flattering cinch to the practical comfort of the sleeping bag silhouette.The hardware is all good quality- I've gotten some really feeble zippers lately but this isn't one of them. The zipper has chunky plastic teeth with metal zips, and the snaps and drawstring toggles are all metal. The whole lining was thoughtfully constructed from different materials (fleece and something sateen) which are pleasantly soft and warm. The pockets are deep and strong, and the hood actually stays on. The neck pillow thing is a lot less weird than it looks, it's a great alternative to nasty faux fur ruffs and keeps the wind out of the neckline. The arm cuffs are very good at sealing the wrists without any scratchy knit ribbing. This is on par with more expensive coats I have seen and owned.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Amazing length and totally worth the price. The jacket is true to size (I bought a medium as a gift for my mom and tried it on before gifting it. I’m usually a small - 5’4” 120lbs and it was a little big on me but not bad. I definitely would’ve gotten a small for myself though). The jacket is perfectly thick so it keeps you warm but it doesn’t look bulky! Highly recommend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This coat is beautiful, warm, fits well, great quality. The neck was a bit bulky and the hood was a bit too scarce. But the pockets are made of that icky microfiber material which I literally cannot stand touching. I’m returning due to the pockets

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The coat is warm and well made. If you want extra room, get a larger size. It fits true to size.

I love this jacket it keeps me nice and warm in this Canadian winter. The only thing is is that the pocket stitching came undone and I can't sew it BC I can't get to the pocket. I notice that some of the seams are coming apart so I do have some concerns about that. But for overall warmth this jacket will definitely keep you warm. Just disappointed about the seams coming apart
LA DEVOLVI EN SEGUIDA. MIDO 1.67 M Y ME QUEDO MUY LARGA. EL MATERIAL ES DE EXCELENTE CALIDAD PERO EL CUELLO ESTA MUY ABULTADO.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 7, 2018
reviews.reviewText: Love the coat! Very chic and stylish. My shoulders are unusually large, and the Medium is very slightly tight with multiple layers of shirt and sweaters underneath, but I would not have been happy with a large. The hood zips off, which is great for times when you want a more formal look. The hood stays forward on your head, and is therefore perfect for snow or rain. Slightly unhappy with the fabric used to fashion the inside of the pockets. It's quite thin, and the cold wind gets to your hands, but if you use gloves, you're fine. The pockets are deep, and I like that. There is also a snap panel at the back, which is great because the coat is so long. If you need to climb or walk quickly, you can unsnap the back and open up your stride a bit. Overall, very, very happy.

After 2 years I have to say I am very happy with this coat. If it is -20 celcius, I can just put this on and go for a walk and feel comfortable. It is not heavy but keeps you warm and you don't have to pile on a lot of layers. A large fits more like an extra large but I don't mind it a little loose.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 29, 2020
reviews.reviewText: I'm a UK size 14 and I bought large after reading other comments and it fits me well. It's super warm and cosy, sometimes a bit too warm for this winter in London but I've had lots of compliments when wearing the coat and wouldn't be without it now. I had to double the cuffs back as they kept slipping down but now they're perfect. The zip is a bit tricky to get started sometimes - a minor complaint. Looking forward to my holiday in Norway next winter when it should really come into its own.
